body:
@andlabs I already know how to build future with code (as wrapper around mutex and channel) (and I've already posted a link above to such code).
But every such code is inelegant and not type-safe.

I'm not propose bringing Javascript's futures/promises to Go. No "then+catch" callbacks.

This proposal is about bringing "Future" abstraction to language in a way suitable for Go language.
And this abstraction is really useful.
